div.head: 唾
div.div: spittle to spit phlegm to spit

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: spittle to spit phlegm to spit

sense.def: ① Physiological Notion of spittle and saliva, i.e. liquids secreted in the oral cavity. Su wen 素問 23: 心 為汗，肺為涕，肝為淚，脾為涎，腎為唾，是謂五液 , “The heart generates sweat. The lung generates snivel. The liver generates tears. The spleen generates saliva. The kidneys generate spittle . These are the so-called ‘five fluids ’”.

② Illness Sign of spitting phlegm. Su wen 素問 19: 上見咳唾，下為氣泄 , “Above there appears coughing and spitting ; below it is qi outflow”. ③ Identical with tu 吐 , spitting from the mouth. Commonly used in combination with additional terms to denote IS, such as tuo xue 唾血 , to spit blood; tuo xian 唾涎 , to spit saliva; tuo nong 唾膿 , to spit pus. Su wen 素問 17: 肺脈搏堅而長，當 病唾血 , “When the beating in the vessels of the lung is firm and extended, [the patient] must suffer from spitting blood”.
